title: Why the November Jobs Report Is Better Than It Looks
content: The number of jobs added was below expectations, but otherwise the report shows an economy on the right track.

title: Cognitive Rehab: One Patient’s Painstaking Path Through Long Covid Therapy
content: Samantha Lewis is relearning some basic aspects of her daily life after struggling with brain fog and other lingering symptoms for more than a year since being infected by the virus.

title: Covid Treatments Are Coming
content: Here’s why they are a big deal.

title: Michigan Shooting Suspect’s Parents Charged With Involuntary Manslaughter
content: “Help me,” the teen accused of killing four of his classmates had scrawled in class hours before the shooting. His parents refused to bring him home and didn’t ask whether he had the handgun they had bought for him days before, a prosecutor said.

title: Billions for Climate Protection Fuel New Debate: Who Deserves It Most
content: The $1 trillion infrastructure law funds programs that tend to favor wealthy, white communities — a test for Biden’s pledge to defend the most vulnerable against climate change.

title: A Slow-Motion Climate Disaster: The Spread of Barren Land
content: Brazil’s northeast, long a victim of droughts, is now effectively turning into a desert. The cause? Climate change and the landowners who are most affected.

title: Thefts, Always an Issue for Retailers, Become More Brazen

title: With Its Exit, Didi Sends a Signal: China No Longer Needs Wall Street
content: With plenty of its own money and a greater desire to control the private sector, Beijing is pushing its companies to tap investors closer to home.

title: What Happened to Amazon’s Bookstore?
content: A 2011 thriller was supposed to cost $15. One merchant listed it at $987, with a 17th-century publication date. That’s what happens in a marketplace where third-party sellers run wild.

title: Stabbed 20 Times by Her Husband, She Now Fights Laws Favoring Abusers
content: Shira Isakov, once a little-known Israeli working in advertising, has become a national force in the struggle to combat domestic violence and change the legal landscape on parental rights.

title: ‘I Was Skeptical.’ How Sondheim Agreed to Change ‘Company.’
content: Days before he died, Stephen Sondheim and the director Marianne Elliott chatted about a Broadway revival of his 1970 musical. With a gender swap, it has a “different flavor,” he said.

title: English Teenager Finds Bronze Age Ax Using a Metal Detector
content: On her third day out with a metal detector, Milly Hardwick, 13, found a hoard of items from more than 3,000 years ago. “We were just laughing our heads off,” she said.
